instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing serial number
threads.message:
Client says he got it from new, no liquid, no EFI password.

Wont show serial number and model.
Checked with a few systems, after resets etc same issue.

Any idea why and how to fix it?

Will  new 'BIOS' chip with serial number from bottom case help?

Thanks

[ATTACH]59307[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing serial number
threads.message:
Serial number must be inserted and need to fix checksum of Fsys region.
Medusa can do all the job onboard.
If not available, upload your BIOS backup somewhere.
